snippet: According to figures from the bureau, violent crimes, including murders, fell by 5.4 percent in the first six months of 2013 compared with the same period in 2012.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation says that violent crimes, including murders, fell by 5.4 percent in first six months of 2013 compared with same period in 2012; drop continues long reduction in violent crime across country.
lead_paragraph: According to figures from the bureau, violent crimes, including murders, fell by 5.4 percent in the first six months of 2013 compared with the same period in 2012.

headline.main: Violent Crimes Declined Across Country in First Six Months of 2013, F.B.I. Says
headline.print_headline: Violent Crimes Declined Across Country in First Six Months of 2013, F.B.I. Says
